definitions.example: The Hessian kept his choicest plunder in a sack that never left his person, for fear that his comrades would steal it.

definitions.definition: To pillage, take or destroy all the goods of, by force (as in war); to raid, sack.
definitions.example: The mercenaries plundered the small town.
The mercenaries plundered all the goods they found.

definitions.definition: To take by force or wrongfully; to commit robbery or looting, to raid.
definitions.example: “Now to plunder, mateys!” screamed a buccaneer, to cries of “Arrgh!” and “Aye!” all around.

definitions.definition: To make extensive (over)use of, as if by plundering; to use or use up wrongfully.
definitions.example: The miners plundered the jungle for its diamonds till it became a muddy waste.
